project_abstract.cdata: The project consists of a hydroelectric power station and associated transmission designed for 2,500 MW with an initial capacity of 1,000 MW, located on the Paranaiba River. Sao Simao is the first major hydroelectric plant on the Paranaiba River, which has an average 2,230 m3/second flow. The project would incorporate a storage reservoir with a usable capacity of 5.5 billion cubic meters with a catchment area of 171,000 sq. kms. The project location and features have been chosen on the basis of minimum costs. Geological conditions and the sources of construction materials have been investigated and found acceptable.
